content:
TITLE: Deploying Monday App to Production
DESCRIPTION: Deploys the Monday app to production using the Monday apps CLI. This process involves selecting the app, choosing a draft version, and initiating the deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run deploy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Configuring Monday Apps CLI Tools
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up the monday.com apps development environment locally using the official CLI tool. Includes steps for installation, initialization with a personal token, and creating a tunnel for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i -g @mondaycom/apps-cli
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps init -t <your-personal-token>
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps tunnel:create
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Monday.com App to Code Hosting
DESCRIPTION: This command deploys the Monday.com app to the Monday code hosting service, prompting the user to select the target app from available options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps code:push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Monday App in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: Starts the server in development mode for the Monday app. This command is used during the development process to test and debug the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Monday Apps CLI Globally
DESCRIPTION: Installs the Monday apps CLI globally on the system, allowing developers to use it across different projects and environments for managing Monday apps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm i -g @mondaycom/apps-cli
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Project Files with npx degit
DESCRIPTION: Command to download the quickstart integration template files from the monday.com GitHub repository
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npx degit github:mondaycom/welcome-apps/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Monday App to Monday Code Hosting
DESCRIPTION: This command initiates the deployment process to Monday code hosting using the Monday Apps CLI. It prompts for app selection and draft version choice.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run deploy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Monday.com App with CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command initializes the Monday.com app using the Monday App CLI, requiring the user's API token for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps init
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Monday Code for App Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Initializes Monday code for first-time deployment of the app. This step requires the developer's Monday access token for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run mapps:init
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required npm dependencies for the Monday.com integration app. Requires Node.js v16.16+ to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for Deployed Monday.com App
DESCRIPTION: This command allows setting environment variables (secrets) for the deployed Monday.com app, which will be injected into the process.env of the deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps code:secret
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Code with Monday Apps CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the integration code using the monday apps CLI tool
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mapps code:push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Monday App Server Logs
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves and displays server logs for the deployed Monday app using the Monday logger. This is useful for monitoring and debugging the app in production.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run logs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables with Monday Apps CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the signing secret environment variable required for app authentication
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mapps code:env -m set -k MONDAY_SIGNING_SECRET -v <your_signing_secret> -i <your app id>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday.com App
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary Node.js dependencies for the Monday.com app using npm (Node Package Manager).
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Development Server with Ngrok Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the client code and runs the server with an ngrok tunnel for local development of the Monday app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Monday App Integration Server with Ngrok (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the server for the Monday.com Quickstart Integration app with an Ngrok tunnel for exposing the local server to the internet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-ts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server with Monday Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the development server using the Monday.com tunnel. This needs to be executed after configuring the MONDAY_SIGNING_SECRET in the .env file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Word Cloud Monday.com App with Ngrok Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Word Cloud app and automatically sets up a virtual ngrok tunnel for public access during development and testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/word-cloud/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Monday App with Automatic Virtual Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Monday app and creates an automatic virtual tunnel for development and testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/docs-viewer/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Monday App Development Server with Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server with the monday tunnel. This makes the app accessible for development and testing at localhost:8301.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/client/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server for Monday.com App
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the development server for the Monday.com app, which will generate a tunnel URL for testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Local Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local development server on port 8080
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Local Tunnel with ngrok
DESCRIPTION: Command to create an ngrok tunnel to the local development server
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
ngrok http 8080
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required node modules for the application using NPM (Node Package Manager).
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/jira-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Word Cloud Monday.com App for Release
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the Word Cloud app for production release, creating optimized static files in the './build' folder.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/word-cloud/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Monday App for Release
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the Monday app for release, creating optimized production-ready files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/docs-viewer/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Node Version
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the correct Node.js version using nvm (Node Version Manager)
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Selecting Node Version Using NVM
DESCRIPTION: Command to select the correct Node.js version using Node Version Manager (NVM). This ensures compatibility with the monday CLI which requires node 18+.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/jira-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Node Version with NVM
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the correct Node.js version using Node Version Manager (NVM). Requires Node v10+ and npm to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/slack-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Selecting Node.js Version with NVM for Monday App Development
DESCRIPTION: Uses Node Version Manager (nvm) to select the correct Node.js version for the Monday app development environment. This ensures compatibility with the app's requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday.com Workspace View App
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install dependencies and set the correct Node.js version using nvm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/workspace-view-app/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary Node.js dependencies for the Monday app using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required npm dependencies for the Monday app project. This should be run first before starting the development server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/client/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Word Cloud Monday.com App
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the Word Cloud app project using npm (Node Package Manager).
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/word-cloud/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the Monday app project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/docs-viewer/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install required node modules using npm
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday App Development
DESCRIPTION: Installs the required node modules for the Monday app using npm. This step is crucial for setting up the development environment with all necessary dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required node modules using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/slack-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday App Integration (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the necessary dependencies for the Monday.com Quickstart Integration app using Yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-ts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ yarn install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday.com Welcome Apps Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to install necessary dependencies for the project using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/onboarding-example/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning GitHub Repository for Monday.com Welcome Apps
DESCRIPTION: This command clones the Monday.com welcome apps repository, which contains sample apps including the GitHub integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: git
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to GitHub Monday Code Sample App Directory
DESCRIPTION: This command changes the current working directory to the GitHub Monday code sample app folder within the cloned repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd apps/github-monday-code
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changing Directory to Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to navigate to the downloaded project directory
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd mondaycode-quickstart
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the application server
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Server with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the server using the NPM run script. This will output a URL that needs to be pasted in the app's Feature Details tab and .env file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/jira-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Application Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the application server using npm start script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/slack-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Monday.com Workspace View App
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server for the workspace view application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/workspace-view-app/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Monday.com Welcome Apps Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the project, which will provide a URL to be used in the app's board view feature's custom URL field.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/onboarding-example/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for GitHub OAuth
DESCRIPTION: Environment variable configuration for storing GitHub OAuth credentials including Client ID and Client Secret required for the integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/github-node/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=your_client_id_here
GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=your_client_secret_here
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Robot.txt for Unrestricted Web Crawler Access
DESCRIPTION: This robot.txt configuration allows all user agents (web crawlers) to access the entire website without any restrictions. It uses the standard syntax for robot.txt files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Monday.com App with Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Monday.com app with a tunnel, which creates a public URL for testing the application. The URL will be displayed in the terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Monday.com App for Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Monday.com app for production. This creates a build folder that can be zipped and uploaded to Monday.com for release.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday.com React App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required dependencies for the Monday.com Quickstart React app. This should be run first before starting the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: Standard robots.txt configuration that allows unrestricted access to all web crawlers. Uses the universal user-agent wildcard (*) with no disallow rules, effectively permitting complete site crawling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/workspace-view-app/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This configuration allows all web crawlers to access the entire website without any restrictions. The User-agent: * directive targets all crawlers, and the empty Disallow: directive indicates no paths are blocked.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-workdocs/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies that all web crawlers (User-agent: *) are allowed to access all content on the site, as there are no disallow directives specified with paths. The file references the robots.txt standard protocol specification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/onboarding-example/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
# https://www.robotstxt.org/robotstxt.html
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring robots.txt for All User Agents
DESCRIPTION: This configuration allows all web crawlers to access the entire website. It specifies no restrictions for any user agent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/client/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
# https://www.robotstxt.org/robotstxt.html
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```
